alert.note: Alert for Northern Elko County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 08 at 3:25AM PST until January 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Elko
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches in mid elevations and up to 10 inches in higher elevations are possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Northern Elko County and Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Two rounds of active weather over the course of the Tuesday and Wednesday timeframe bring a combination of snowfall and strong sustained winds. This will lead to periods of treacherous travel conditions, particularly in portions of the watch area. Even though there is a lull in active snowfall Tuesday evening, this won`t last long enough to provide any break from poor weather conditions and accumulating snowfall coupled with strong winds return during the Wednesday morning hours.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Northern Elko County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range
